title: Smartphone theft is soaring at MSP airport
text:
Smartphone theft is soaring at MSP airport Jul 23, 2015, 7:11am CDT Share Mark Reilly Managing Editor Minneapolis / St. Paul Business Journal Mark Reilly Managing Editor Minneapolis / St. Paul Business Journal Home of the Day Nancy Kuehn | MSPBJ Minneapolis-St. Paul International Airport reported nearly 300 mobile-device thefts lastâ€¦ more A rise in mobile-device thefts has Minneapolis-St. Paul International Airport officials cautioning travelers to keep an eye on their smartphones. Minnesota Public Radiio reports that thefts are up 17 percent in 2015 compared with the year-ago period. That follows a 42 percent rise between 2013 and 2014. There were nearly 300 cases last year. Most of the thefts are crimes of opportunity: Travelers leave their device on a chair, or plugged into an outlet, and then wander off or forget them as they rush for a plane. And then somebody swipes it. The lesson: Keep track of your stuff, and keep geolocation features switched on so there's a chance police can track it down if it's stolen.
